reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at this well located hotel on our trips to and from the south of France for many years. We know what to expect at a Campanile and Troyes Sud has always met our needs. In our experience the food buffet is one of the best in a Campanile.
reviews.title: Somewhat tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, on this occasion we were assigned a room immediately below the staff family quarters and suffered from really unacceptable noise until after 11pm.
reviews.title: Hotel OK but don't eat there

reviews.text: The hotel is obviously heavily used and in need of refurbishment. The outdoor stairs were badly damaged and a real trip hazzard.
reviews.title: The restaurant was terrible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was not properly cleaned and the towels looked as though they had been poorly laundered. Such a shame that a very useful hotel for travellers from the UK is not maintaining it's prior standards.
reviews.title: Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at that hotel a few years ago and complained about it to Louvre Hotels. Nothing has changed despite our optimism! The concrete stairs to the upper floor were cracked and the supports rusty and in one place almost eaten through. This time at least it was warm enough, but the restaurant is still not good. Campanile restaurants used to be good value for money but not now. My partner ordered a roast lamb dish and was dished up three large pieces of fat, reminiscent of pork belly without the meat! He complained and he got another three! In the end he asked for fish. When we paid the hotel bill the next day they tried to charge us for the fish as well! Breakfast had almost run out with 45 minutes to go before they closed and a request for more croissants was met with a surly "Finit"!! Complaining at reception was a waste of time.
reviews.title: Take a map with you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Campanile was very similar to the others we had stayed in in France, but the restaurant was superb. We had the basic €13 meal of buffet hors d'oeuvres and main course, and a respectable €10 bottle of Bordeaux Blanc, making $36.
reviews.title: Terrific restaurant!

likes.liked: — Quiet location, efficiently run, tolerated my poor French, inexpensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The range and quality of the hors d'oeuvres was outstanding, and a meal in itself. I had salmon and spinach lasagne, which again was very good.
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.text: We stayed here on a journey to the south and found it to be perfectly adequate for a stopover. Although basic and rooms were abit musty, it was clean and comfortable. Would not really like to spend more than 1 night here though.
reviews.title: Adequate for an overnight stop

reviews.text: Just off the A5 and the A26 the hotel is handy for Troyes and for the Factory outlets at Pont St. Marie.However, this Campanile has gone down hill with scruffy décor and a very poor very non-French restaurant . The Duck was terrible might have been left over from lunch time and the French beans swimming in water, the buffet was tired and the service avoiding what they knew would be a complaint.The Room was clean but the overall experience poor value for money. I will not be going back
reviews.title: Beware the Duck

reviews.text: Stayed there at the weekend, room was clean and tidy and comfortable, albeit basic. Kettle and Tea and Coffee was a bonus. We stayed in the other adjacent block last year, half the price but more 'budget' in feel.
reviews.title: Clean and tidy, but beware

reviews.text: However, as both complexes share the same restaurant, if its simply a quick overnight stay, the Premier Classe is more cost effective.
reviews.title: One of the best

reviews.text: Food in the restaurant is good as is the service....but this time we were overcharged with an * euro drink on the bill. Not sure if it was a mistake or a try on - so beware.
reviews.title: standard campanile
OK for one night maximum
reviews.text: Campaniles are a pretty well known identikit package and the only things that distinguish them are the quality of service and the state of the bldgs/rooms. On these points this one doesn't rate too high. The information from reception about the need to book for dinner (usual at a Campanile) was plain wrong. The exterior of the living quarters resembled a run down '60's holiday camp though inside the room was OK. The wi-fi was pathetic. We registered a 0.36mbps download speed and even worse upload speed. We paid €60 for the overnight room in advance and noted that the rack rate was €78 which has to be some kind of joke. No one should have to pay that sort of price in France for a room of this mediocre quality. This was the first time we've used the Troyes Campanile. Next time it's back to using one of the Reims options where most offer secure car parks, unlike here.

It is what you would expect from a place that is aimed at a quick stop over on your way somewhere else..... the room was quite good, large enough and clean on a whole (just one large cobweb in the bathroom) we had asked for a cot for our one year old but it never came but we had our own travel one with us.
reviews.title: Just what you would expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was good, nice buffet and the mains were very good, service was quick and very polite, we did eat early though at about 7pm as it opened. I would stay again on my way south.
reviews.title: Typical Campanile

reviews.text: If you use Campanile as an overnighter (which is what they are good for) then you know what to expect. Rooms are all much the same, large enough, clean with a comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Good hotel, good food

reviews.text: Lady on reception was lovely, friendly and helpful. Restaurant menu seems to be same in all Campanile, Buffet starter selection very good, and very tasty,(this one had freshly poached salmon), dessert buffet also very good. Main meal OK, nothing special, standard for Campanile.
reviews.title: Good for one night
